intro: Barleria glandulostamina, commonly known as the glandular-stamened barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a notable species in botanical studies.
